title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5608.4 - Prohibited actions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5608.4 - Prohibited actions

State Regulations
(a) Dishonest obtaining of a benefit. No authorized or prohibited
contestant shall, in relation to an authorized contest, dishonestly obtain a
benefit by any act, practice or scheme or otherwise dishonestly obtain a
benefit through the use of any device or item. (b) Alteration or falsification of
information. Any person who knowingly alters or falsifies information
recorded on any record, document or report required under this Chapter, at the
time of the transaction or after the fact, for any purpose, including, without
limitation, for the purpose of concealment, deception, or circumvention of
internal control minimum procedures, may be subject to the penalties and other
actions the commission may take pursuant to law (e.g., a fine, penalty or
revocation of registration by the commission). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5608.4

Adopted

New

York State Register October 18, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 42, eff. 10/18/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
